name: Xeol
headline: Close your outdated dependency attack vector
description:
Pronounced Zee-O-L. 

End-of-life (EOL) and outdated software are a black box of vulnerabilities with very limited remediation paths. These 2 factors combine to make managing them a necessary proactive practice. Xeol enables enterprises and Fortune 500s to create a proactive EOL management program that directly contributes to better vulnerability management and lower cyber insurance.

founders.name: ShiHan Wan, Founder
founders.description:
CEO @ Xeol. Backend Engineer.

Previously helped build 2 startups from early to ü¶Ñ, now doing that for Xeol.

generated_description:
### Summary of Xeol

**Company Name:** Xeol  
**Founded:** 2023  
**Location:** New York  
**Team Size:** 3 Employees  
**Funding:** Recently raised $3.2 million in Seed Round investment  
**Notable Partnership:** Dalton Caldwell as Group Partner  
**Incubator:** Y Combinator Batch S23  

**Mission:**  
Xeol's mission centers on addressing the vulnerabilities associated with end-of-life (EOL) and outdated software. These types of software represent a significant attack vector for cyber threats, often leaving enterprises in the dark with limited remediation options. By developing a proactive EOL management program, Xeol helps organizations‚Äîfrom nimble startups to Fortune 500 companies‚Äîenhance their vulnerability management and, in turn, reduce their cyber insurance costs.

**What They Do:**  
Xeol enables companies to seamlessly manage their outdated dependencies. Their focus is on helping organizations identify and rectify unsupported software, thus streamlining processes that otherwise would be clunky and reactive. This service not only bolsters security but also contributes actively to better overall risk management.

**Recent Highlight:**  
Xeol is making waves with its recent funding achievement of $3.2 million, which positions them well to further enhance their offerings and outreach. They are also collaborating with HeroDevs to provide users with more robust solutions for EOL issues related to open source software.

**Tags:** Security, Cybersecurity, New York  

For anyone navigating the complex landscape of software dependencies, transitioning to proactive measures in EOL management could be a game changer. You can learn more about Xeol and their mission on their website: [Xeol.io](https://www.xeol.io).
